title: "How to Perform Full Breathing Exercise for Physical and Spiritual Benefits"
first_phrase: In the previous part of this text, the author explains how to perform a breathing exercise that not only benefits the body but also has positive effects on the mind. The exercise involves rhythmic breathing and taking deep and consistent breaths. In this concluding part, the author emphasizes the importance of making conscious decisions and having clarity of intention. The three psychological conditions needed for a decision of will are discussed: knowing what one wants, having the ability to achieve it, and being sincere and truthful in one's desire. The concepts and exercises discussed in the text are easy to understand and follow, making this a valuable resource for anyone interested in improving their physical and mental well-being through breathing techniques.

last_phrase: In conclusion, remember to maintain a steady and even breath, gradually pulling in your abdomen as you exhale, but keeping your chest out. Continue to breathe consciously and only through your nostrils. Increase the number of these full breaths and strive to make your breathing complete, spontaneous, and instinctive.
